programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: College GameDay
programme.desc: Originating from the site of one of the day's best matchups, with a sea of fans cheering wildly in the background, host Rece Davis and analysts Lee Corso, Kirk Herbstreit and Desmond Howard talk college football for three hours, reporting on the top teams, games, players and storylines. David Pollack and Maria Taylor contribute reports, interviews and features. Davis replaced longtime host Chris Fowler in 2015.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The premier matchup in Week 0 of the NCAA football season sees the No. 10 Seminoles face the Yellow Jackets. Florida State added former Clemson quarterback DJ Uiagalelei as a graduate transfer from Oregon State to help defend its ACC championship.

programme.title: College Football Countdown
programme.desc: A look at the day's college football action, featuring news, highlights and game previews.

programme.desc: Action from high school football.

programme.title: UFC Fight Night: Cannonier vs. Borralho
programme.desc: Kaan Ofli vs. Mairon Santos, featherweight; Robert Valentin vs. Ryan Loder, middleweight; Angela Hill vs. Tabatha Ricci, strawweight; Jared Cannonier vs. Caio Borralho, middleweight. From UFC Apex in Las Vegas.

programme.title: Formula 1: Grand Prix Sunday
programme.desc: Teams make final preparations for the day's race. Plus, interviews, features, and Martin Brundle's popular "grid walk."

programme.title: Formula 1 Racing
programme.desc: Formula One returns from summer break with the Dutch Grand Prix. Championship leader Max Verstappen is winless in four races, his longest skid since 2020. Verstappen's record-setting 10 consecutive wins in 2023 included his third straight Dutch GP.

programme.title: E60
programme.desc: ESPN's morning sports magazine show, featuring the biggest names and stories in sports.

programme.title: Baseball Tonight: Sunday Night Countdown
programme.desc: Leading into each of ESPN's Sunday Night Baseball telecasts is this special edition of "Baseball Tonight." Host Karl Ravech teams with analysts and reporters to present fans a detailed preview of the network's exclusive, national game of the week. Highlights of the day's other games, interviews with players and managers, and key storylines from around the league also fill the hourlong show. Mark Teixeira, Eduardo Pérez, Tim Kurkjian and Buster Olney are among the analysts.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: The Astros visit the Orioles in a clash of elite American League teams. Houston sends out Yusei Kikuchi, who is 2-0 with a 2.42 ERA in four starts with the Astros. Kikuchi was 1-0, 1.74 in two outings against Baltimore this season while with Toronto.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: 2024 US Open Tennis
programme.desc: From the USTA Billie Jean King National Tennis Center in Flushing, N.Y.

programme.title: 2024 US Open Tennis
programme.desc: From the USTA Billie Jean King National Tennis Center in Flushing, N.Y.

programme.title: Decade of Dominance
programme.desc: A commemorative look at the 10-year anniversary of the College Football Playoff that highlights the SEC's success across the last decade. During that time, the SEC earned 12 CFP appearances and six National Championships -- the most of any league.

programme.title: College Football Live
programme.desc: ESPN's daily college football show sharing reactions to the day's biggest stories and previews of each week's most important matchups. Kelsey Riggs and Jen Lada host alongside contributors Desmond Howard, Sam Acho, Greg McElroy and Pete Thamel.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: College Football Live
programme.desc: ESPN's daily college football show sharing reactions to the day's biggest stories and previews of each week's most important matchups. Kelsey Riggs and Jen Lada host alongside contributors Desmond Howard, Sam Acho, Greg McElroy and Pete Thamel.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: UFC Unleashed
programme.desc: Witness the rise of "Sugar" Sean O'Malley to superstardom with a collection of his biggest wins to date.

programme.title: UFC Next Level
programme.desc: Following the journey of new UFC fighters as they attempt to move from their Contender Series win to their UFC debut.

programme.desc: From UFC APEX in Las Vegas.

programme.desc: Third free practice of round 15 of the 2024 Formula One World Championship, the Netherlands Grand Prix at Circuit Zandvoort in Zandvoort, Netherlands.

programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Lynx take another shot at the Fever in the Gopher State. Indiana escaped Minnesota with an 81-74 victory on July 14 courtesy of Aliyah Boston's 17 points, 16 rebounds and four blocks. The Fever are 2-0 since returning from the Olympic break.

programme.title: Players Only: Shaq and Kobe
programme.desc: Basketball legends and former teammates Shaquille O'Neal and Kobe Bryant sit down for a conversation, covering everything from their three consecutive championships with the Los Angeles Lakers to their relationship over the years.

programme.desc: The Lynx take another shot at the Fever in the Gopher State. Indiana escaped Minnesota with an 81-74 victory on July 14 courtesy of Aliyah Boston's 17 points, 16 rebounds and four blocks. The Fever are 2-0 since returning from the Olympic break.

programme.title: Basketball Stories
programme.desc: From breaking backboards to topping the rap charts, Shaquille O'Neal's rookie season was both dominant and memorable. Patrick Ewing, Alonzo Mourning, Charles Barkley, and many more share stories and highlights of Shaq's first year in the NBA.

programme.title: Shaq: The Big Conversation
programme.desc: A one-on-one interview with Shaquille O'Neal,conducted by his TNT colleague and "Inside the NBA" host Ernie Johnson. Shaq chats about his childhood and his relationship with his stepfather and how both influenced his Hall of Fame career.

programme.title: Basketball Stories
programme.desc: George The Iceman Gervin is a pro and college Hall of Famer who was once the most dominant scorer in the NBA. His accolades include four NBA scoring titles, nine All-Star appearances and being honored as one of the top 50 NBA players of all time.

programme.title: Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: Game 5 of the 1984 Eastern Conference first-round playoffs. Isiah Thomas' 35 points and 12 assists were not enough to overcome Bernard King's 44 points and 12 rebounds as the Knicks defeat the Pistons 127-123.

programme.title: Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: Game 7 of the 1988 Eastern Conference semifinals. Larry Bird out duels Dominique Wilkins with 47 points, 20 of them in the 4th quarter.

programme.desc: Candace Parker, Diana Taurasi, A'ja Wilson and more look at how the WNBA and its players have evolved through the first 25 years of the league.

programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Wings kick off a five-game homestand by hosting the Sparks. Los Angeles won the last two meetings to move to 2-1 against Dallas this year. Sparks star Dearica Hamby is posting 22.7 points and 9.7 rebounds per game versus the Wings in 2024.

programme.title: Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: Michael Jordan scores 64 points but his Chicago Bulls come up short against the Orlando Magic. Led by rookie Shaquille O'Neal, who scores 29 points and grabs 24 rebounds, Orlando wins the game 128-124. From Jan. 16, 1993.

programme.title: Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: Kobe Bryant and Antawn Jamison both score 51 points in a 125-122 overtime game. From Dec. 6, 2000.

programme.title: Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: Game 7 of the 2008 Eastern Conference semifinals. LeBron James scores 45 points but it wasn't enough as the Cavaliers lose to the Celtics, who advance to the Eastern Conference Finals.

programme.title: Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: Tracy McGrady (62 points and 10 rebounds) and Gilbert Arenas put on a show (40 points) for NBA fans. From March 10, 2004.

programme.title: Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: Chris Bosh's career night is better than Dwight Howard's, as Bosh scores a career-high 41 points to overcome Howard's career-high 32 points as the Toronto Raptors emerge with a 113-103 victory over the Orlando Magic. From Feb. 7, 2007.

programme.title: Aguas arriba
programme.desc: La experiencia de la pesca con mosca en Latinoamérica. La búsqueda de truchas en la Patagonia, sea trout y salmones en Chile, dorados en el norte de Argentina y las magníficas especies como bonefish, pertmit y tarpon de Centroamérica y Caribe.

programme.title: Béisbol Esta Noche
programme.desc: Si usted es un fanático del béisbol, entonces no querrá perderse esta noche de recapitulación donde se muestran los momentos más destacados de todos los juegos y actualizaciones de los que siguen en curso. Regularmente presentado por Karl Ravech, quien está acompañado por una combinación de analistas, como los ex jugadores John Kruk y Dave Winfield, el ex manager Terry Francona, y los periodistas Tim Kurkjian y Buster Olney.
